field.name: SWRSTSD
field.description: Software reset for Serial Flash domain

enumeratedValue.description: Serial Flash domain flops are reset. Does not reset configuration registers. It is advisable to reset both the serial flash domain and AHB domain at the same time. Resetting only one domain might lead to side effects. The software resets need the clock to be running to propagate to the design. The MCR[MDIS] should therefore be set to 0 when the software reset bits are asserted. Also, before they can be deasserted again (by setting MCR[SWRSTSD] to 0), it is recommended to set the MCR[MDIS] bit to 1. Once the software resets have been deasserted, the normal operation can be started by setting the MCR[MDIS] bit to 0

field.name: SWRSTHD
field.description: Software reset for AHB domain

enumeratedValue.description: AHB domain flops are reset. Does not reset configuration registers. It is advisable to reset both the serial flash domain and AHB domain at the same time. Resetting only one domain might lead to side effects. The software resets need the clock to be running to propagate to the design. The MCR[MDIS] should therefore be set to 0 when the software reset bits are asserted. Also, before they can be deasserted again (by setting MCR[SWRSTHD] to 0), it is recommended to set the MCR[MDIS] bit to 1. Once the software resets have been deasserted, the normal operation can be started by setting the MCR[MDIS] bit to 0

field.name: END_CFG
field.description: Defines the endianness of the QSPI module.For more details refer to Byte Ordering Endianess

field.name: DQS_LAT_EN
field.description: DQS Latency Enable:\n This field is valid when latency is included in between read access from FLash in case when QSPI_MCR[DQS_EN] is 1

enumeratedValue.description: DQS feature with latency included enabled

field.name: DQS_EN
field.description: DQS enable:\n This field is valid for both SDR and DDR mode

enumeratedValue.description: DQS enabled. When enabled, the incoming data is sampled on both the edges of DQS input when QSPI_MCR[DDR_EN] is set, else, on only one edge when QSPI_MCR[DDR_EN] is 0. The QSPI_SMPR[DDR_SMP] values are ignored

field.name: DDR_EN
field.description: DDR mode enable

enumeratedValue.description: 2x and 4x clocks are disabled for SDR instructions only
2x and 4x clocks are enabled supports both SDR and DDR instruction

field.name: CLR_RXF
field.description: Clear RX FIFO. Invalidates the RX Buffer. This is a self-clearing field

enumeratedValue.description: Read and write pointers of the RX Buffer are reset to 0. QSPI_RBSR[RDBFL] is reset to 0

field.name: CLR_TXF
field.description: Clear TX FIFO/Buffer. Invalidates the TX Buffer content. This is a self-clearing field

enumeratedValue.description: Read and write pointers of the TX Buffer are reset to 0. QSPI_TBSR[TRCTR] is reset to 0

field.name: MDIS
field.description: Module Disable

enumeratedValue.description: Allow external logic to disable QSPI clocks

field.name: SCLKCFG
field.description: Serial Clock Configuration

field.name: IDATSZ
field.description: IP data transfer size. Defines the data transfer size in bytes of the IP command

field.name: PAR_EN
field.description: When set, a transaction to two serial flash devices is triggered in parallel mode

field.name: SEQID
field.description: Points to a sequence in the Look-up table

field.name: TCSS
field.description: Serial flash CS setup time in terms of serial flash clock cycles

field.name: TCSH
field.description: Serial flash CS hold time in terms of serial flash clock cycles

field.name: TDH
field.description: Serial flash Data In hold time:\n This helps in meeting the Data In Hold time requirement of a Flash

enumeratedValue.description: Data aligned with the posedge of Internal reference clock of QSPI
Data aligned with 2x serial flash half clock
Data aligned with 4x serial flash half clock

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID:\n The ID of the AHB master associated with BUFFER0

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: HP_EN
field.description: High Priority Enable: When set, the master associated with this buffer is assigned a priority higher than the rest of the masters

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID:\n The ID of the AHB master associated with BUFFER1

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID:\n The ID of the AHB master associated with BUFFER2

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: MSTRID
field.description: Master ID:\n The ID of the AHB master associated with BUFFER3

field.name: ADATSZ
field.description: AHB data transfer size

field.name: ALLMST
field.description: All master enable:\n When set, buffer3 acts as an all-master buffer

field.name: SEQID
field.description: Points to a sequence in the Look-up-table

field.name: PAR_EN
field.description: When set, a transaction to two serial flash devices is triggered in parallel mode

field.name: QSPISRC
field.description: QSPI clock source select

field.name: DQSLPEN
field.description: When this bit is set the internal generated DQS is selected and looped back to QSPI, without going to DQS pad. DQSPADLPEN should be cleared when this bit is set

field.name: DQSPADLPEN
field.description: When this bit is set the internal generated DQS will be sent to the DQS pad first and then looped back to QSPI. DQSLPEN should be cleared when this bit is set

enumeratedValue.description: DQS loop back from DQS pad is disabled
DQS loop back from DQS pad is enabled

field.name: DQSPHASEL
field.description: Select phase shift for internal DQS generation. These bits are always zero in SDR mode

field.name: DQSINVSEL
field.description: Select clock source for internal DQS generation

enumeratedValue.description: Use 1x internal reference clock for the DQS generation
Use inverse 1x internal reference clock for the DQS generation

field.name: CK2EN
field.description: Flash CK2 clock pin enable

field.name: DIFFCKEN
field.description: Differential flash clock pins enable

field.name: OCTEN
field.description: Octal data pins enable

enumeratedValue.description: QSPI0B_DATAx pins are assigned to QSPI Port B
QSPI0B_DATAx pins are assigned to QSPI Port A

field.name: DLYTAPSELA
field.description: Delay chain tap number selection for QSPI Port A DQS

field.name: DLYTAPSELB
field.description: Delay chain tap number selection for QSPI Port B DQS

field.name: TPINDX0
field.description: Top index of buffer 0

field.name: TPINDX1
field.description: Top index of buffer 1

field.name: TPINDX2
field.description: Top index of buffer 2

field.name: SFADR
field.description: Serial Flash Address. The register content is used as byte address for all following IP Commands

field.name: CAS
field.description: Column Address Space

field.name: WA
field.description: Word Addressable

enumeratedValue.description: Word (2 byte) addressable serial flash mode

field.name: HSENA
field.description: Half Speed serial flash clock Enable

enumeratedValue.description: Disable divide by 2 of serial flash clock for half speed commands
Enable divide by 2 of serial flash clock for half speed commands

field.name: HSPHS
field.description: Half Speed Phase selection for SDR instructions

field.name: HSDLY
field.description: Half Speed Delay selection for SDR instructions

field.name: FSPHS
field.description: Full Speed Phase selection for SDR instructions

enumeratedValue.description: Select sampling at inverted clock. This bit is also used in DQS mode and ignored when using non-DQS DDR instructions

field.name: FSDLY
field.description: Full Speed Delay selection for SDR instructions. Select the delay with respect to the reference edge for the sample point valid for full speed commands:

enumeratedValue.description: Two clock cycles delay. This bit is also used in DQS mode and ignored when using non-DQS DDR instructions

field.name: DDRSMP
field.description: DDR Sampling point

field.name: RDBFL
field.description: RX Buffer Fill Level, indicates how many entries of 4 bytes are still available in the RX Buffer

field.name: RDCTR
field.description: Read Counter, indicates how many entries of 4 bytes have been removed from the RX Buffer

field.name: WMRK
field.description: RX Buffer Watermark: This field determines when the readout action of the RX Buffer is triggered

field.name: RXBRD
field.description: RX Buffer Readout: This bit specifies the access scheme for the RX Buffer readout

enumeratedValue.description: RX Buffer content is read using the AHB Bus registers QSPI_ARDB0 to QSPI_ARDB15. For details, refer to Exclusive Access to Serial Flash for AHB Commands
RX Buffer content is read using the IP Bus registers QSPI_RBDR0 to QSPI_RBDR15

field.name: TRBFL
field.description: TX Buffer Fill Level

field.name: TRCTR
field.description: Transmit Counter

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: TX Data On write access the data is written into the next available entry of the TX Buffer and the QPSI_TBSR[TRBFL] field is updated accordingly

field.name: WMRK
field.description: Determines the watermark for the TX Buffer

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Module Busy: Asserted when module is currently busy handling a transaction to an external flash device

field.name: IP_ACC
field.description: IP Access: Asserted when transaction currently executed was initiated by IP bus

field.name: AHB_ACC
field.description: AHB Access: Asserted when the transaction currently executed was initiated by AHB bus

field.name: AHBGNT
field.description: AHB Command priority Granted: Asserted when another module has been granted priority of AHB Commands against IP Commands

field.name: AHBTRN
field.description: AHB Access Transaction pending: Asserted when there is a pending request on the AHB interface

field.name: AHB0NE
field.description: AHB 0 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 0 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB1NE
field.description: AHB 1 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 1 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB2NE
field.description: AHB 2 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 2 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB3NE
field.description: AHB 3 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 3 buffer contains data

field.name: AHB0FUL
field.description: AHB 0 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 0 buffer is full

field.name: AHB1FUL
field.description: AHB 1 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 1 buffer is full

field.name: AHB2FUL
field.description: AHB 2 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 2 buffer is full

field.name: AHB3FUL
field.description: AHB 3 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 3 buffer is full

field.name: RXWE
field.description: RX Buffer Watermark Exceeded: Asserted when the number of valid entries in the RX Buffer exceeds the number given in the QSPI_RBCT[WMRK] field

field.name: RXFULL
field.description: RX Buffer Full: Asserted when the RX Buffer is full, i

field.name: RXDMA
field.description: RX Buffer DMA: Asserted when RX Buffer read out via DMA is active i.e DMA is requested or running

field.name: TXEDA
field.description: Tx Buffer Enough Data Available

field.name: TXWA
field.description: TX Buffer watermark Available

field.name: TXDMA
field.description: TXDMA

field.name: TXFULL
field.description: TX Buffer Full: Asserted when no more data can be stored

field.name: DLPSMP
field.description: Data learning pattern sampling point: The sampling point found by the controller with the data learning pattern

field.name: TFF
field.description: IP Command Transaction Finished Flag: Set when the QSPI module has finished a running IP Command

field.name: IPGEF
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Grant Error Flag: Set when the following condition occurs: A write access occurs to the QSPI_IPCR[SEQID] field and the QSPI_SR[AHBGNT] bit is set

field.name: IPIEF
field.description: IP Command Trigger could not be executed Error Flag

field.name: IPAEF
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Access Error Flag

field.name: IUEF
field.description: IP Command Usage Error Flag: Set when in parallel flash mode the execution of an IP Command is started with more than one pad enabled and the sequence pointed to by the sequence ID contains a WRITE or a WRITE_DDR command

field.name: ABOF
field.description: AHB Buffer Overflow Flag: Set when the size of the AHB access exceeds the size of the AHB buffer

field.name: AIBSEF
field.description: AHB Illegal Burst Size Error Flag: Set whenever the total burst size(size x beat) of an AHB transaction is greater than the prefetch data size

field.name: AITEF
field.description: AHB Illegal transaction error flag

field.name: ABSEF
field.description: AHB Sequence Error Flag: Set when the execution of an AHB Command is started with a WRITE or WRITE_DDR Command in the sequence pointed to by the QSPI_BUFxCR register

field.name: RBDF
field.description: RX Buffer Drain Flag: Will be set if the QSPI_SR[RXWE] status bit is asserted

field.name: RBOF
field.description: RX Buffer Overflow Flag: Set when not all the data read from the serial flash device could be pushed into the RX Buffer

field.name: ILLINE
field.description: Illegal Instruction Error Flag: Set when an illegal instruction is encountered by the controller in any of the sequences

field.name: TBUF
field.description: TX Buffer Underrun Flag: Set when the module tried to pull data although TX Buffer was emptyor the buffer contains less than 128bits of data

field.name: TBFF
field.description: TX Buffer Fill Flag: Before writing to the TX buffer, this bit should be cleared

field.name: DLPFF
field.description: Data Learning Pattern Failure Flag: Set when DATA_LEARN instruction was encountered in a sequence but no sampling point was found for the data learning patternin case only 8 bit data learning is requested for non DQS mode

register.name: RSER
register.description: Interrupt and DMA Request Select and Enable Register

field.name: TFIE
field.description: Transaction Finished Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No TFF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IPGEIE
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Grant Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IPGEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IPIEIE
field.description: IP Command Trigger during IP Access Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IPIEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IPAEIE
field.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Access Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IPAEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: IUEIE
field.description: IP Command Usage Error Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No IUEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: ABOIE
field.description: AHB Buffer Overflow Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No ABOF interrupt will be generated

field.name: AIBSIE
field.description: AHB Illegal Burst Size Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No AIBSEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: AITIE
field.description: AHB Illegal transaction interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.description: No AITEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: ABSEIE
field.description: AHB Sequence Error Interrupt Enable: Triggered by ABSEF flags of QSPI_FR

enumeratedValue.description: No ABSEF interrupt will be generated

field.name: RBDIE
field.description: RX Buffer Drain Interrupt Enable: Enables generation of IRQ requests for RX Buffer Drain

enumeratedValue.description: No RBDF interrupt will be generated

field.name: RBOIE
field.description: RX Buffer Overflow Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No RBOF interrupt will be generated

field.name: RBDDE
field.description: RX Buffer Drain DMA Enable: Enables generation of DMA requests for RX Buffer Drain

enumeratedValue.description: No DMA request will be generated

field.name: ILLINIE
field.description: Illegal Instruction Error Interrupt Enable. Triggered by ILLINE flag in QSPI_FR

enumeratedValue.description: No ILLINE interrupt will be generated

field.name: TBFDE
field.description: TX Buffer Fill DMA Enable

field.name: TBUIE
field.description: TX Buffer Underrun Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No TBUF interrupt will be generated

field.name: TBFIE
field.description: TX Buffer Fill Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: No TBFF interrupt will be generated

field.name: DLPFIE
field.description: Data Learning Pattern Failure Interrupt enable . Triggered by DLPFF flag in QSPI_FR register

enumeratedValue.description: No DLPFF interrupt will be generated

field.name: SUSPND
field.description: When set, it signifies that a sequence is in suspended state

field.name: SPDBUF
field.description: Suspended Buffer: Provides the suspended buffer number. Valid only when SUSPND is set to 1'b1

field.name: DATLFT
field.description: Data left: Provides information about the amount of data left to be read in the suspended sequence

field.name: BFPTRC
field.description: Buffer Pointer Clear: 1: Clears the sequence pointer for AHB accesses as defined in QSPI_BFGENCR

field.name: IPPTRC
field.description: IP Pointer Clear: 1: Clears the sequence pointer for IP accesses as defined in QSPI_IPCR This is a self-clearing field

field.name: TPADA1
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash A1. In effect, TPADxx is the first location of the next memory

field.name: TPADA2
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash A2. In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory

field.name: TPADB1
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash B1.In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory

field.name: TPADB2
field.description: Top address for Serial Flash B2. In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory

field.name: DLPV
field.description: Data Learning Pattern Value: This value is used for data learning in DDR and DQS mode

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: RX Data

field.name: KEY
field.description: The key to lock or unlock the LUT. The KEY is 0x5AF05AF0. The read value is always 0x5AF05AF0

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Locks the LUT when the following condition is met: This register is written just after the LUTKEYLUT Key Register The LUT key register was written with 0x5AF05AF0 key

field.name: UNLOCK
field.description: Unlocks the LUT when the following two conditions are met: 1

field.name: OPRND
field.description: Operand for INSTR0

field.name: PAD
field.description: Pad information for INSTR0

field.name: INSTR
field.description: Instruction 0
